commit message: Log: Correct the tag.

FileResponseHandler: handleResponse(): Simplify the code.

Use HttpEntity.writeTo() instead of looping ourselves.
ItemsContentProvider: Move simple HTTP downloading into HttpUtils.

FileResponseHandler: Optionally decompress gzipped content.

Unfortunately we cannot now use writeTo() to simplify the code.

Child-fragments layout: Remove extra padding.

The parent fragment already has padding around its edges.

Classify fragment layout: Use just one top-level ScrollView.

Instead of a separate ScrollView in each child fragment.
DecisionTree: Avoid some duplication of code.
Remove a now-unnecessary comment.

Singleton: Add, and use, an init() method with a callback.

We can then do the initialization in an AsyncTask.
ClassifyFragment: Add and use showLoadingView helper method.
Fix some comments.
Singleton.init(): Do the initialization in an AsyncTask.

Get, and show, the icons for the answers and checkboxes.

This get the single .png file containing all the icons,
and then parses (hackily, not robustly) the CSS (without a stable URI)
to get the positions of each icon in the file, then splits it up.

The cache is not yet preserved across sessions.

Use the (dark) Holo theme instead of Holo.Light.

This works better with our mostly-black images and our white icons.
Layout improvements.
SubjectFragment: Added an Invert toggle button to show the inverted image.
DecisionTree: Make some fields private.

QuestionFragment: Add a Help button to show the Help text in a dialog.

This doesn't yet show the examples.
sloan_tree.xml: Regenerate with HTML entities unescaped.
sloan_tree.xml: Regenerated with the examples count for each answer.
DecisionTree: Parse the examplesCount for each answer.
QuestionFragment: Use a custom Help dialog, showing the example images too.
Make some buttons have smaller text.
QuestionHelpDialogFragment: Show examples for the checkboxes too.
QuestionHelpDialogFragment: Improve some spacing.
QuestionHelpDialogFragment: Fix a typo to show answer examples again.
fragment_subject.xml: Use adjustViewBounds so we show the image full size.
IconsCache: Save the icons in the local cache so we can just reload them.

IconsCache: Use an LruCache instead of a HashMap.

This avoids us filling up the memory with icons that we rarely view.
They will be loaded from the cache in the filesystem (in getIcon()),
again if necessary.
Improve a log message.
IconsCache: Check for network connectivity.
ItemsContentProvider: Improve some log messages.

Fail, with a warning message, when we would need a network connection.

ItemsContentProvider: Throw a custom exception when an network connection is
needed.
We catch this directly when using call(), but we cannot catch the exception
from a CursorLoader, so we have to guess at the cause of an empty cursor.

ItemsContentProvider: query(): Do not throw our NoNetworkException exception.

Because this unavoidably crashes the app. Just return an empty Cursor instead and
let the caller guess at the cause.

ItemFragment: Override onSaveInstanceState() to save the actual ID.

Otherwise we can get the original virtual 'next' ID when the fragment is
recreated after rotation.
QuestionFragment: Override onSaveInstanceState() to save the current question ID.
SubjectFragment: Override onSaveInstanceState() to keep the image inverted after rotation.
QuestionFragment: Override onSaveInstanceState() to keep the classification in progress.

BaseActivity/ListActivity: Remove the remains of the two-pane structure.

We will just use a different layout for the Classify fragment/activity on bigger screens,
instead of having both the list and the detail (classify) in one activty.
Classify: Add a layout for wider screens/orientations, such as tablets.

Use SharedPreferences.Editor.apply() instead of commit().

Suggested by android-lint.

QuestionFragment.ClassificationInProgress: Add the CREATOR object.

Noticed by android-lint. Strangely, it doesn't seem to be used by the current
code, which recreates (or maybe just reuses) the ClassificationInProgress
fine already.

Remove incorrect/obsolete layout parameters.

Suggested by android-lint.

Correct layout params of ScrollViews.

Suggested by android-lint.

Remove unused resources and layouts.

Suggested by android-lint.

Layouts: Use *Start/End instead of *Left/Right.

Suggested by android-lint.

Minor code style fixes.

Suggested by android-lint.

Remove unnecessary imports.

Suggested by android-lint.

Use some more Java 7 syntax.

Suggested by android-lint.
Add a TODO comment.
LoginActivity: Remove some dead code.
*ResponseHandler: Remove unused ContentProvider field.
HttpUtils: Remove unused callback.

Help dialog: Avoid a nested ScrollView.

Suggested by android-lint.

build.gradle: Use specific gradle version.

Suggested by android-lint.
Layouts: Extract some text to (translatable) string values.

Turn the Help dialog into a normal Activity.

The dialog had too much stuff in it and looked out of place.
QuestionHelpFragment: Open example in their own activity, not the browser.

Classify: Correct the margins/padding.

Now the Classify activity has no padding or margins.
The Classify Fragment's ScrollView has no margin or padding at
its sides, so the scrollbar shows up at the far edge, but it has
a margin at the top to separate it from the ActionBar.
This seems to achieve this layout:
https://developer.android.com/design/style/metrics-grids.html
The ScrollView's LinearLayout has a margin at the sides to separate
the content from the sides (and from the scrollbar).

Classify: Put the top margin in the activity, not the fragment.

This makes it a bit easier to reuse the fragment in a different
arrangement.
Layout: Rename some IDs.
ExampleViewer layout: Use same margins as Classify activity/fragment.

Classify: Use clipToPadding to scroll into the top gap.

Change the activity's top margin to top padding in the fragment's
ScrollView, so we can use clipToPadding='false' to make it scroll
its content into the gap between the content and the ActionBar.
This only works if the padding is on the ScrollView (or ListView
or GridView, I think) itself.
See https://plus.google.com/+AndroidDevelopers/posts/LpAA7q4jw9M
List: Use clipToPadding='false' here too.

Example Viewer: Put the content in a ScrollView.

The pictures are not big enough to need it but it seems wise to
support bigger images in theory.
QuestionHelpFragment: Check for a connection when showing full example images.

Remove the More menu item.

It is only useful for debugging. The ContentProvider gets more items
automatically in advance.

Classify: Move the Invert button into the ActionBar.

This saves a little vertical space.

Move the Help button into the ActionBar and rename it to Examples.

This saves more space.
Classify: Reduce some spacing.
LoginActivity: Start with the last-successful username.
LoginActivity: Add Forgot password and Register links.

ItemsContentProvider: call(): Do the login immediately and return the result.

Instead of using an AsyncTask, because there does not seem to be an async
way to return a call() result.
LoginActivity: Return a result and use it in ZooFragment.requestLogin().
Fix the build after breaking it in the previous commit.

LoginActivity: Show a Toast message when login was successful.

Just to give some clue that things are OK.
ItemsContentProvider: Add (disabled for now) code to regular upload classifications.
Example Viewer: Expand the image to the full width, as when Classifying.

QuestionFragment: Use a GridLayout for answers and checkboxes.

Now it looks neater, like in the web UI.
Unfortunately I had to hard-code the number of columns.

ExampleViewerFragment: Slight code improvement.

SubjectFragment: Make the image invert when clicked, like in the web UI.
List: Make the images as big as possible.

gridview_cell_fragment_list.xml: Remove unnecessary intermediate parent layout.

This now lets the icons be as big as possible.
List: Improve padding.

List: Add a margin at the right of the text.

This stops the text from being right up against the edge of the screen,
while allowing the GridView's icons to be up against the edge of the screen.

Use a more appropriate launcher icon.

This is based on public-domain NASA Hubble image of Messier 81 from here
http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Commons:Featured_pictures/Astronomy#mediaviewer/File:Messier_81_HST.jpg
The .png files were created with this tool:
http://romannurik.github.io/AndroidAssetStudio/icons-launcher.html

It would be better to use some image that fits better into a square.

fragment_subject: Replace the RelativeLayout with a LinearLayout.

It only has one child anyway.

Tablet layout: Classify: Split the screen equally horizontally.

With the image (SubjectFragment) on the left and the rest
(ClassifyFragment) on the right. To get this effect I specified
equal weights for each child view, but I also had to specify
width='match_parent' to make it actually work, which is odd.
Classify: Add a margin between the fragments.
Remove unnecessary imports.
Layout: Remove obsolete parameters.
Remove an unused resource.

Tablet layout: use layout-w850dp instead of layout-sw-600dp.

sw means the smallest of width or height.
w means the width in the current orientation.
This then means Use this layout if the current width is more than
850dp.
This makes it use the standard vertical layout on my Nexus 10 when
in portrait mode, so we can see a large picture because the picture
has enough width to expand.
The 850 is odd, but seems to be what works.
fragment_question_help.xml: Fix indenting.
Layout: Fix some tools:context lines.
Layout XML: Make sure they all have the <?xml delaration.

Examples: Do not show the onscreen dialog.

* app/src/main/AndroidManifest.xml: Remove windowSoftInputMode from
the .QuestionHelpActivity declaration. This was copy/pasted from the
.LoginActivity declaration, which actually uses the keyboard.

Specify an identifiable User Agent for GET and POST HTTP requests.

This makes the app more visible in server logs and could be used to
filter out classifications if something went very wrong.
The User Agent is murrayc.com-android-galaxyzoo
